sd_qsci.hamiltonian package

Submodules

sd_qsci.hamiltonian.checks module

Check molecular orbital integrals give correct RHF energy.

sd_qsci.hamiltonian.checks.rhf_energy_from_mo_integrals(mol, rhf)[source]

Compute RHF total energy directly from MO integrals. Assumes closed-shell (RHF) occupations: doubly-occupy the lowest nocc spatial MOs.

Return type:

float

sd_qsci.hamiltonian.fermion_hamiltonian module

sd_qsci.hamiltonian.fermion_hamiltonian.hamiltonian_matrix(h1, g2_phys, enuc=0.0)[source]

Build the full Fock-space Hamiltonian using precomputed sparse ladder operators.

Parameters:

  • h1 (ndarray) – One-electron integrals matrix of shape (N, N).

  • g2_phys (ndarray) – Two-electron integrals tensor in physicist notation of shape (N, N, N, N).

  • enuc (float, optional) – Nuclear repulsion energy, by default 0.0.

Returns:

Sparse matrix representation of the many-body Hamiltonian.

Return type:

scipy.sparse.csr_matrix

sd_qsci.hamiltonian.fermion_hamiltonian.ladder_operators(N)[source]

Generate annihilation and creation operator matrices for N spin orbitals.

Parameters:

N (int) – Number of spin orbitals.

Returns:

([a_p], [a_p†]) where each element is a sparse matrix representing the annihilation and creation operators respectively.

Return type:

tuple of lists

sd_qsci.hamiltonian.fermion_ops module

sd_qsci.hamiltonian.fermion_ops.annihilate(state, q)[source]

Apply a_q to |state>. Returns (phase, new_state) or None if occupation is 0.

Parameters:

  • state (int)

  • q (int)

sd_qsci.hamiltonian.fermion_ops.create(state, p)[source]

Apply a_p^dagger to |state>. Returns (phase, new_state) or None if occupation is 1.

Parameters:

  • state (int)

  • p (int)

sd_qsci.hamiltonian.pyscf_glue module

sd_qsci.hamiltonian.pyscf_glue.hamiltonian_from_pyscf(mol, rhf)[source]

Return the sparse Hamiltonian (csr) on the full spin-orbital Fock space. Acts on an occupation number vector basis. BLOCK spin ordering: [α0..α(n-1), β0..β(n-1)].

sd_qsci.hamiltonian.spin_blocks module

sd_qsci.hamiltonian.spin_blocks.spin_expand_1e(h1_spatial)[source]

Expand spatial 1e integrals (n,n) into spin-orbital (2n,2n) in BLOCK order (all α then all β).

Parameters:

h1_spatial (ndarray)

Return type:

ndarray

sd_qsci.hamiltonian.spin_blocks.spin_expand_2e_phys(g_phys)[source]

Expand spatial 2e integrals in physicist order (p,r,q,s) into spin-orbital (BLOCK α…β). Nonzero only when spin(P)==spin(R) and spin(Q)==spin(S). Returns G[P,Q,R,S] with shape (2n,2n,2n,2n).

Parameters:

g_phys (ndarray)

Return type:

ndarray
